content:
SyndicationContent Class

In this Article

A base class that represents syndication content.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TypeForwardedFrom("System.ServiceModel.Web, Version=3.5.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35")]
public abstract class SyndicationContent

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • SyndicationContent

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

This is an abstract class and cannot be instantiated directly. It is used as the base class for the following syndication content types:

  • TextSyndicationContent
  • UrlSyndicationContent
  • XmlSyndicationContent

Constructors summary

SyndicationContent()

Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationContent class.
SyndicationContent(SyndicationContent)

Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationContent class with the specified SyndicationContent instance.

Properties summary

AttributeExtensions

Gets the attribute extensions for this content.
Type

Gets the syndication content type.

Methods summary

Clone()

Creates a copy of the SyndicationContent instance.
CreateHtmlContent(String)

Creates a new TextSyndicationContent instance with the specified HTML content.
CreatePlaintextContent(String)

Creates a new TextSyndicationContent instance with the specified plain text content.
CreateUrlContent(Uri,String)

Creates a new UrlSyndicationContent instance with the specified Uri and media type.
CreateXhtmlContent(String)

Creates a new TextSyndicationContent instance with the specified XHTML content.
CreateXmlContent(Object)

Creates a new XmlSyndicationContent instance with the specified data contract object.
CreateXmlContent(XmlReader)

Creates XML syndication content.
CreateXmlContent(Object,XmlObjectSerializer)

Creates a new XmlSyndicationContent instance with the specified data contract object and data contract serializer.
CreateXmlContent(Object,XmlSerializer)

Creates a new XmlSyndicationContent instance with the specified object and XML serializer.
WriteContentsTo(XmlWriter)

Writes the contents of this SyndicationContent object to the specified XmlWriter.
WriteTo(XmlWriter,String,String)

Writes the contents of this object to the specified XmlWriter within the specified element and element namespace.

Constructors

  • SyndicationContent()

    Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationContent class.

    protected SyndicationContent ();
  • SyndicationContent(SyndicationContent)

    Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationContent class with the specified SyndicationContent instance.

    protected SyndicationContent (System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent source);

    Parameters

    • source
      SyndicationContent

      The SyndicationContent instance to use to initialize the new instance.

Properties

  • AttributeExtensions

    Gets the attribute extensions for this content.

    public System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName,string> AttributeExtensions { get; }

    Property Value

    • Dictionary<XmlQualifiedName,String>

      A dictionary that contains the attribute extensions for this object.

    Remarks

    Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. The syndication object model allows you to add custom attributes to a syndication content type (for example, TextSyndicationContent). When serialized to Atom 1.0, these attributes appear within the <content> element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, these attribute are ignored.

    Example

    The following XML shows how a custom attribute added to a TextSyndicationContent instance is serialized to Atom 1.0. 

    <content type="text" customAttribute="value">Some text content</content>
  • Type

    Gets the syndication content type.

    public abstract string Type { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the type of syndication content.

    Remarks

    This property is abstract, so it must be accessed on an instance of a syndication content type (a class derived from SyndicationContent). The .NET Framework defines the following syndication content types:

    • TextSyndicationContent
    • UrlSyndicationContent
    • XmlSyndicationContent

    • This class contains a number of static helper methods for creating the various types of syndication content:

    • CreateHtmlContent(String)
    • CreatePlaintextContent(String)
    • CreateUrlContent(Uri,String)
    • CreateXhtmlContent(String)
    • CreateXmlContent(Object)
    • CreateXmlContent(Object,XmlObjectSerializer)
    • CreateXmlContent(Object,XmlSerializer)

    Parameters

    Remarks

    The media type parameter can be set to any known MIME type value as defined in RFC 2046.

    Remarks

  • WriteTo(XmlWriter,String,String)

    Remarks

    The content contained in this object is written within the specified outer element.
